titles: A faithful discovery of a treacherous design of mystical Antichrist displaying Christs banners, but attempting to lay waste Scriptures, churches, Christ, faith, hope, &c. and establish paganism in England. Seasonably given in a letter to the faithful in and near to Beverley. Containing an examination of many doctrines of the people called Quakers in Yorkshire, together with a censure of their way, and several items concerning the designs of God, Satan, and men, in these things, recommended to the consideration of them who are in good earnest for Christ.
author: Pomroy, John.
Feake, Christopher, fl. 1645-1660.
Glisson, Paul.
Kellet, Joseph.
publisher: Printed by H. Hills for Thomas Brewster, and are to be sold at the Three Bibles in Pauls Church-yard,
notes: Authors' note "To the reader" signed: John Pomroy, Paul Glissen, Joseph Kellet.
